title: Enkidu 2013 High Mayacamas Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A dusty, sunbaked note in the aroma of this full-bodied wine meets robust and ripe fruit, wood smoke and very concentrated clove, black cherry and dark-chocolate flavors. The color is dark and deep, tannins are very firm, and the mouthfeel is somewhat astringent. This wine needs time to reach its peak, and will be best after 2022.

title: Hirsch 2016 Kammern Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: A restarined but fresh note of pure lemon rises from the glass. The palate is just as fresh and adds an earthy, stony touch as well as the fruit and texture of russet pear. This is slender and refreshing, yet full of flavor. The finish is lip-smackingly lemony.

title: Hartenberg 2014 Cape Winemakers Guild CWG Auction Shiraz (Stellenbosch)
description: Winemaker: Carl Schultz. Plush, saucy red and black berry fruit takes centerstage on the nose of this plush, ripe Shiraz. Waves of vanilla and sweet spice add depth and decadence, continuing through the palate and medium-length finish. The palate is smooth and surprisingly accessible, with medium tannins lending ample grip and structure. Well balanced and enjoyable now, drink through 2022.

title: Kontos 2013 Beckett Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend Cabernet Sauvignon (61%), Merlot (31%) and Syrah. The aromas open up with vibrant notes of cranberry, cherry, baking spice, licorice, vanilla and barrel spice. The palate is concentrated with cherry and blackberry flavors that show a lot of textural appeal. The tannins bring a touch of grit.

title: Foley 2014 T Anchor Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The somewhat restrained nose of this bottling is powered by chaparral and herbs, with sagebrush, juniper and thyme decorating the tight cranberry fruit. The shrubby element sticks to the palate as well, with more garrigue spice seasoning the cranberry and raspberry base.

title: Goldeneye 2014 Gowan Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Substantial and smoky, this full-bodied wine has a vivid oak component. Wood smoke and toasted-bread aromas meet ripe black-cherry flavors on the palate, plus clove and cinnamon on the finish. It's delicious in a bold, rich style.

title: Feiler-Artinger 2016 Neuburger (Burgenland)
description: The slightest touch of creamy vanilla shows on the nose. The palate has a similar, inviting creaminess combined with crisp but friendly lemon freshness. A rounded nuttiness adds interest to this beautifully curvy but toned wine.

title: Fess Parker 2014 Clone 2A Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This clonal study explores the earthy side of the grape, with mulberry and dark cranberry fruit running alongside damp oak forest and slightly funky chaparral aromas. Lively flavors consume the palate quickly with tart cherry and peppery spice, all lifted by mouthwatering acidity.

title: Fess Parker 2015 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: This refreshing and crisply designed Viognier conveys restrained aromas of white peach and vanilla. The palate shows yellow melon and creamy peach, but with a razor-sharp edge of acidity and a compelling chalky texture. The acid sizzles into the finish.

title: Leonetti Cellar 2015 Merlot (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: A blend of Loess Vineyard and Leonetti Old Block, this wine is 100% varietal. The aromas are bright and pure, with notes of raspberry, cherry, plum, anise and spice. The flavors deliver, with a sense of understated appeal.

title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2016 Le Chant du Soleil  (Tavel)
description: The cave cooperative in Tavel is the largest producer in the appellation, so it's reassuring that so many of its cuvées scored highly in this year's tastings. Cinnamon and clove notes accent vibrant red berries and citrus in this medium- to full-bodied wine that's long, intense and crisp on the finish.

title: Loimer 2016 Langenlois Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: Ripe notions of yellow Mirabelle plum make for a friendly, inviting opening. Lemony freshness persists on the palate where it is joined by spicy white pepper and a savory, salty undertone of yeast. This is refreshing, light and moreish.

title: Johan Joubert 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Granite Selection Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch)
description: Winemaker: Johan Joubert. Notes of peach, apricot, melon and orange preserves abound on the nose and mouth of this rich, yet not overdone, wine. There's a bit of weight to the midpalate, countered by ample acidity and toasty woodspice that picks up the medium-length finish. It's certainly approachable and delicious now, but should continue to hold and develop well through 2022.

title: Adams Bench 2014 The V Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aged in 100% new French oak, aromas of roasted coffee bean, herb, char and dark fruit give way to lightly grainy dark-fruit flavors. The wood seems a bit primary at present but it still brings a lot of appeal. Give it some time to integrate.

title: Ardor 2015 Stoney Vine Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Fermented 40% whole cluster and aged in four-year-old 500L puncheons, bright aromas of fresh asparagus, herb, flower, ember and earth are followed by a blend of fruit and savory flavors. It provides an appealing texture that keeps the interest high.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2013 Blessings Petite Sirah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This is a strong showing for this growing region south of San Jose, which was historically home to prominent vineyards. Crushed black peppercorns, thyme and rosemary show on the nose against tart blackberry juice, with cola and a touch of blackened beef. Black currant and elderberry arise on the sip along with white-pepper spice, held together by balanced acidity and tannins. It's ripe, but far from overdone.

title: B Vintners 2016 Cape Winemakers Guild Inboet Storie Cinsault (Stellenbosch)
description: Winemaker: Bruwer Raats. There's a lot to like in this pretty, elegant and floral wine. It starts off with notes of bright red cherry, wild strawberry and currant, followed by supporting notes of pressed carnation, freshly turned forest floor and earthy minerality. The mouthfeel is like crushed satin, boasting fine, well-integrated tannins and bright acidity for overall balance. Hints of cured meat and baking spice unfold on the close. Drink now–2021.

title: Mariposa 2016 Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling combines the variety's zippy character with a touch of ripeness, which makes it accessible to many palates. Aromas of fresh-cut apple and green papaya meet with a very stony minerality on the nose. The palate's powerful texture and sizzling acidity carry riper flavors of Gala apple and Anjou pear that continue deep into the finish.

title: Markus Huber 2016 Obere Steigen Grüner Veltliner (Traisental)
description: Savory notes of chervil combine with fresh citrus and ripe pear on the nose. The plate still has a yeasty, leesy touch and a full texture on the generous but fresh body. Slight spritz adds to the verve. The finish is both warming and refreshing, and chock full of pear fruit.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Considered warm by Central Coast standards, Paso Robles is not always ideal for Chardonnay, but the veteran squad at Castoro did well on this nicely tight bottling. Key-lime pith and crisp Gala apple show on the nose, while solid acidity delivers flavors of rainy slate and squeezed citrus. There's good grippy tension to the sip as well.

title: Cellars 33 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This coastal wine hails from two sites, including the Gloria Vineyard in Sebastopol, and Hummingbird Hill in the Petaluma Gap. It stays true to form in its light approach and high-toned acidity. Earthy, light in color and bristling in black tea, cranberry and pomegranate, it's lightly spiced in cardamom.

title: Château Bousquette 2012 Prestige Red (Saint-Chinian)
description: A biodynamic red blend, this opens with focused red-cherry and -plum tones that are dusted with hints of cola spice and vanilla. The smooth palate offers plush berry flavors that are framed by structured tannins. Hints of pressed iris and bittersweet chocolate grace the lingering finish.

title: Château Capet-Guillier 2014  Saint-Émilion
description: Owned by négociant firm Antoine Moueix, this property on the plateau of Saint-Emilion, has produced a ripe and balanced vintage in 2014. The oak aging has enhanced the richness of the wine with its balanced tannins and black-currant fruits. It will age well and be ready to drink from 2021.

title: Château d'Agassac 2015 Château Pomiès-Agassac  (Haut-Médoc)
description: The second wine from this estate with its moated medieval castle is finely structured while showing all the delicious fruit of this vintage. It has spice, some firm tannins and juicy black-currant fruitiness. It will develop well and relatively quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Laffitte Carcasset 2015  Saint-Estèphe
description: The are firm indications of wood aging in this wine, meaning it needs some time. For now, it is all spice and exuberant blackberry fruits. As it develops, it will integrate well to produce a rich wine with plenty of blackberry and damson fruits. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Lanbersac 2014 Cuvée Vieilles Vignes  (Puisseguin Saint-Émilion)
description: This rich wine, produced from old vines, is dense and concentrated. It does have the fruitiness of the vintage but that is allied to the dark-black fruit and powerful tannins. There are spice and wood flavors still developing. Drink this fine wine from 2020.

title: Cocchi 2011 Totocorde Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: White flower, toasted nut, citrus and white stone fruit aromas set the tone on this crisp sparkler. The elegant palate offers creamy pear, yellow apple, nectarine zest and bread crust alongside fresh acidity that brightens the rich flavors. An elegant perlage conveys finesse.

title: Domaine de Mourchon 2014 Grande Réserve Red (Côtes du Rhône Villages Séguret)
description: Cherries, cinnamon and clove mark the nose, while the flavors include cherries, Mexican chocolate and floral notes. This is full bodied and robust without being hard, easing into a long, velvety-textured finish. Drink this blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah from 2018 through 2025.

title: Brotte 2014 Domaíne Barville Roussanne (Châteauneuf-du-Pape)
description: Full-bodied and broad, this is a big mouthful of barrel-fermented Roussanne. Modest florals highlight grilled pear and pineapple fruit, toasted marshmallow and honey, turning to stone fruit on the long finish.

title: Seven Hills 2014 Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: The inaugural release of this wine is 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot, coming from Summit View, Pepper Bridge, Cockburn, McClellan Estate, Stone Valley, Seven Hills, Waliser Rocks and Fire Ridge vineyards. Green herb, black fruit, coffee and anise aromas give way to beautifully balanced red- and black-fruit flavors. The acidity brings a sense of vibrancy, while the tannins provide plenty of structure.
